newsitem.title: CHINA: Yuan ends down at intraday low vs US dollar.
newsitem.headline: Yuan ends down at intraday low vs US dollar.

text.p: The Chinese yuan closed down at an intraday low of 8.2930 on Monday against the U.S. dollar in Shanghai from 8.2924 on Friday due to speculative selling just ahead of the close, dealers said.
The weighted average price on Friday was 8.2923.
The yuan still has strong upward momentum despite today's speculative selling, dealers said.
The yuan opened little changed at 8.2923 and moved up slightly to consolidate around the 8.2920 level for most of the session, hitting a high of 8.2914.
Trading was not active, dealers said.
"The yuan was firm for most of the session, indicating strong pro-yuan sentiment," said one dealer. "The selling emerged just ahead of the close, when most investors have stopped trading."
Dealers said they expected the yuan to bounce up to move around the 8.2920 level on Tuesday.
The yuan closed up slightly at 7.1501 from 7.1866 against 100 Japanese yen and down at 1.0720 from 1.0705 against the Hong Kong dollar.
